channel.title: CVE Feed for Progress Software Corporation -- WhatsUp Gold
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Progress Software Corporation -- WhatsUp Gold

item.title: CVE-2023-6365|2023-12-14T16:05:08.330Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1, a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability has been identified. It is possible for an attacker to craft a XSS payload and store that value within a device group.
If a WhatsUp Gold user interacts with the crafted payload, the attacker would be able to execute malicious JavaScript within the context of the victims browser.

item.title: CVE-2023-6364|2023-12-14T16:04:40.029Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1, a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability has been identified. It is possible for an attacker to craft a XSS payload and store that value within a dashboard component.
If a WhatsUp Gold user interacts with the crafted payload, the attacker would be able to execute malicious JavaScript within the context of the victims browser.

item.title: CVE-2023-6368|2023-12-14T16:06:29.101Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1, an API endpoint was found to be missing an authentication mechanism. It is possible for an unauthenticated attacker to enumerate information related to a registered device being monitored by WhatsUp Gold.

item.title: CVE-2023-6367|2023-12-14T16:05:50.619Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1, a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability has been identified. It is possible for an attacker to craft a XSS payload and store that value within Roles.
If a WhatsUp Gold user interacts with the crafted payload, the attacker would be able to execute malicious JavaScript within the context of the victims browser.

item.title: CVE-2023-6366|2023-12-14T16:05:31.492Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1, a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability has been identified. It is possible for an attacker to craft a XSS payload and store that value within Alert Center.
If a WhatsUp Gold user interacts with the crafted payload, the attacker would be able to execute malicious JavaScript within the context of the victims browser.

item.title: CVE-2023-6595|2023-12-14T16:06:11.767Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1, an API endpoint was found to be missing an authentication mechanism. It is possible for an unauthenticated attacker to enumerate ancillary credential information stored within WhatsUp Gold.

item.title: CVE-2024-4562|2024-06-04T17:56:09.548Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.2 ,
an SSRF vulnerability exists in Whatsup Gold's
Issue exists in the HTTP Monitoring functionality.
Due to the lack of proper authorization, any authenticated user can access the HTTP monitoring functionality, what leads to the Server Side Request Forgery.

item.title: CVE-2024-4561|2024-06-04T17:53:36.300Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.2 ,
a blind SSRF vulnerability exists in Whatsup Gold's FaviconController that allows an attacker to send arbitrary HTTP requests on behalf of the vulnerable server.
